problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the area of the green semi-circle is 157 and the angle CBA is vertical to EBF, compute the area of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (8365.449999999999, 18210.81)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 20029.16)
E = (34.23, -21783.19)
F = (-9965.77, -21783.19)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 16))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-14965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-24965.77, 25034.23)

# Draw the magenta arc (B, A, C)
radius_magenta = 19.99493
start_angle_magenta = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle_magenta = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle_magenta > end_angle_magenta:
    end_angle_magenta += 360

magenta_arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius_magenta,
    theta1=start_angle_magenta,
    theta2=end_angle_magenta,
    facecolor="magenta",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(magenta_arc)

# Draw the green arc (C, B)
radius_green = 19.99493
start_angle_green = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))
end_angle_green = start_angle_green + 180

green_arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius_green,
    theta1=start_angle_green,
    theta2=end_angle_green,
    facecolor="green",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(green_arc)

# Draw the gray triangle (B, E, F)
gray_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, E, F], closed=True, color="gray", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(gray_triangle)

# Draw right-angle marker at E
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

draw_right_angle(ax, B, E, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((E[0] + F[0]) / 2, (E[1] + F[1]) / 2, "10", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")
ax.text((B[0] + E[0]) / 2, (B[1] + E[1]) / 2, "24", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The area of the green semi-circle is 157 so the length of the BC diameter can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{8 * 157}{\pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{1256}{3.14}} = \sqrt{400.0} = 20$. The length of the hypotenuse of the BEF triangle is 24 and the length of the side opposite to the EBF angle is 10, so the EBF angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{10}{24}) = \arcsin(0.42) = 24.83$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle EBF so the degree of the CBA angle = 24.83. The BC radius and the CBA angle of the ABC sector are 20 and 24.83 respectively. So the area of ABC sector can be computed as $\frac{24.83}{360} * (\pi * 20^2) = 0.07 * 1256.0 = 87.92$. Therefore the final answer is 87.92.
